intro: Gymnosporia undata, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain seeds, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Gymnosporia undata is also valued for its potential medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
